title: China‚Äôs Green Transformation: Issues, Policies, Prospects, Zhang Xuehua
description:
Xuehua Zhang is senior fellow at the Lishui Institute of Ecology and Environment at Nanjing University.  Her area of research interests are environmental policymaking, enforcement and compliance, coordinated pollution control, agricultural sustainability, low carbon rural development, public participation, waste management and environmental legal institutions. She received her PhD from the Emmet Interdisciplinary Program in Environment and Resources at Stanford University.
Xuehua has contributed to the international policy community and its understanding about the actual functions and operations of China‚Äôs environmental regulatory system, mostly through providing consulting services to governments and international organizations such as US EPA, NRDC, Energy Foundation, and World Bank. 

Xuehua has been investigating the implementation of the energy-saving and emission-reduction targets during the 11th Five-Year plan in China, measurement, reporting, and verification issues related to the preparation of greenhouse gas emission inventories at the national and provincial levels in China, and operation and management of continuous emission monitoring systems (CEMS).
She recently finished a study on community waste segregation and compost in Bengaluru, India and is currently conducted a similar experiment in Chengdu, China.
https://www.cambridge.org/core/journals/china-quarterly/article/implementation-of-pollution-control-targets-in-china-has-a-centralized-enforcement-approach-worked/F50673906FFDB8F27C71D6549F8F3F9A/core-reader
https://pangea.stanford.edu/people/xuehua-zhang

Our video series ‚ÄúChina‚Äôs Green Transformation: Issues, Policies, Prospects‚Äù was filmed on the sidelines of our 2019 lecture series held at the University of G√∂ttingen from April to July 2019. In our conversations with Li Hongtao and Zhang Xuehua we discuss air pollution, media and public participation as well as environmental politics in waste management and recycling. 
https://www.cemeas.de/lecture-series-sose-2019-chinas-green-transformation/

In this video Zhang Xuehua discusses three questions:
In your research you focus on environmental governance and the relevance of bottom-up approaches. Can you give us some examples?  
Your recent project focuses on waste management in China. What are your most important findings about Environmental NGOs and Social Enterprises?
Why did China enact an import ban on plastic waste?
How does this influence centralized waste management in China?

title: A Special and Extremely Committed Person: Farewell Lecture by Stephan Klasen
description: More than 250 guests from all over the world paid tribute to Prof. Dr. h.c. Stephan Klasen, Ph.D. after his farewell lecture on 16 November 2019 in the Alfred-Hessel-Saal of the Paulinerkirche. Stephan Klasen has been Professor of Development Economics at the Faculty of Business and Economics since 2003. He conducts research on issues of poverty, inequality, the environment and gender in developing countries. Born in 1966, he retires prematurely because he has been suffering from amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) since 2015 and is severely restricted in language and mobility.

title: Solidarit√§t in der Medizin ‚Äì Kollektivit√§t im Gesundheitswesen
description:
‚ÄûKonfliktfeld Solidarit√§t in der Medizin: wer mit wem und warum? Zur Rolle von Solidarit√§t in aktuellen gesundheits-/medizin-/ forschungsethischen Debatten‚Äú von Prof. Dr. Barbara Prainsack, Institut f√ºr Politikwissenschaft, Universit√§t Wien. Vortrag im Rahmen der Jahrestagung der Akademie f√ºr Ethik in der Medizin e.V. (AEM), die vom 26. bis 28. September 2019 an der Universit√§t G√∂ttingen stattfand.

In der aktuellen Medizin- und Pflegeethik steht √ºblicherweise das Individuum im Mittelpunkt. Diese Sichtweise verdeckt allerdings die ethische Bedeutung von Kollektiven, also Gruppen und Gemeinschaften, in Medizin und Gesundheitsversorgung. Gerade im klinischen Alltag sind es oft Kollektive, die mit moralischen Fragen ringen: So m√ºssen unter anderem Behandlungsteams mit Patientinnen und Patienten sowie Angeh√∂rigen gemeinsam eine Entscheidung in reproduktionsmedizinischen Fragen oder am Lebensende treffen. Im Bereich der Forschung entstehen neue Kollektive, wenn zum Beispiel Betroffene als Teilnehmer partizipativer Forschung zusammen mit Wissenschaftlerinnen und Wissenschaftlern die Richtung und konkrete Durchf√ºhrung mitbestimmen.

Daraus ergeben sich grunds√§tzliche Fragen und Konfliktfelder, die insbesondere im Bereich von Gesundheitsethik / Public Health immer deutlicher werden: Was ist ein Kollektiv? Welche normativen Erwartungen sind mit verschiedenen Gruppentypen verbunden? Was unterscheidet Kollektive untereinander? Welche ethischen Konflikte zwischen Individual- und Kollektivinteressen bestehen aktuell in medizinischer Versorgung bzw. im klinischen Alltag? Welche Rolle soll Gruppensolidarit√§t spielen, wenn es zum Beispiel um die Aktivierung von B√ºrgerinnen und B√ºrgern zur Forschungsteilnahme, Organ- und Gewebespende geht?

Die Jahrestagung der Akademie f√ºr Ethik in der Medizin e.V. (AEM), ausgerichtet vom Institut f√ºr Ethik und Geschichte der Medizin der Universit√§tsmedizin G√∂ttingen, widmete sich den Fragestellungen dieser Thematik.

title: Andreas Hahn: Gesund und leistungsf√§hig ‚Äì besser mit oder ohne Fleisch? Ringvorlesung
description:
Prof. Dr. Andreas Hahn, Leibniz Universit√§t Hannover: Gesund und leistungsf√§hig ‚Äì besser mit oder ohne Fleisch? Vortrag im Rahmen der √∂ffentlichen Ringvorlesung "Tier oder Tofu ‚Äì Was isst die Zukunft?" an der Universit√§t G√∂ttingen, gehalten am 26. November 2019 in der Aula am Wilhelmsplatz.

Im Verlauf der letzten 50 Jahre ist der Konsum von Fleisch in vielen L√§ndern rapide angestiegen, der Preis f√ºr Fleisch gleichzeitig stark gesunken. Zugleich wird in der Gesellschaft zunehmend kontrovers √ºber Vegetarier und Vielfleischesser diskutiert. Politisch wird eine Transformation des Agrar- und Ern√§hrungssektors gefordert, insbesondere aus Klima- und Tierschutzgr√ºnden.

Die Ringvorlesung zeigt aus interdisziplin√§rer Perspektive zentrale Facetten dieser Auseinandersetzung um den Konsum tierischer Produkte auf. Ziel ist es, einen wissenschaftlich fundierten Dialog zur Transformation des Ern√§hrungssektors anzuregen. Die Vortr√§ge greifen Fragen nach einer ‚ÄûNachhaltigen Ern√§hrung‚Äú auf, beleuchten Klimaschutz- und Weltern√§hrungsfragen, Anforderungen des Tierschutzes, aber auch ern√§hrungswissenschaftliche und ethische Perspektiven.

Die Vortragenden k√∂nnen zwar die Frage "Tier oder Tofu?" nicht endg√ºltig beantworten, daf√ºr geben sie aber vielf√§ltige Hintergrundinformationen f√ºr fundierte eigene Ern√§hrungsentscheidungen und einen Einblick in den Stand der Nachhaltigkeitsforschung.

Weitere Informationen gibt es unter https://www.uni-goettingen.de/de/613408.html.

title: Studierende zum Umgang mit Demenz und Demenzvorhersage
description:
Das Institut f√ºr Ethik und Geschichte der Medizin der Universit√§tsmedizin G√∂ttingen hat in Kooperation mit dem IEGUS-Institut f√ºr europ√§ische Gesundheits- und Sozialwirtschaft (Berlin /Bochum) ein interdisziplin√§res Lehrkonzept entwickelt. Die Zielgruppe sind Studierende der Medizin, der Kranken- und Pflegewissenschaften, der Psychologie und der Sozialwissenschaften. Das Lehrkonzept ist ein wesentlicher Bestandteil des vom Bundesministerium f√ºr Bildung und Forschung gef√∂rderten Projekts Diskursverfahren ‚ÄûKonfliktfall Demenzvorhersage‚Äú, in dem wir eine breite √∂ffentliche Debatte angesto√üen haben. 

Das Projektverfahren zielt mit den Seminaren (Universit√§tsmedizin G√∂ttingen) und Workshops (Universit√§t Bochum) langfristig darauf, gemeinsam mit Studierenden didaktische Materialien f√ºr die Beratung im Rahmen der pr√§diktiven Demenzdiagnostik zu testen und weiterzuentwickeln. Dieses Vorhaben verfolgt das Ziel einer zuk√ºnftigen Sicherung einer qualitativ hochwertigen und langfristig aufrechterhaltenen Beratung.

Im Sommersemester 2019 befragten wir unsere Studierenden im interdisziplin√§ren Wahlfach "Umgang mit Demenz und Demenzvorhersage. Aktuelle Herausforderungen in Ethik, Geschichte und Theorie der Medizin und des Gesundheitswesens" in G√∂ttingen, warum das Seminar und die Thematik f√ºr sie als Studierende wichtig ist:
‚Ä¢ Welche Erkenntnisse haben Sie aus dem Seminar gewonnen? 
‚Ä¢ Ist das Thema Ethik der Demenz bzw. ethische Aspekte der Demenzvorhersage f√ºr Ihr Studium relevant und wenn ja, warum?
‚Ä¢ Wo sehen Sie die Relevanz des Themas auch f√ºr Ihr sp√§teres Berufsfeld?

Da dieses Projekt ein Diskursprojekt ist, empfinden wir es als Projektteam als √§u√üerst wichtig, die Stimmen zuk√ºnftig im Gesundheitsbereich t√§tiger und beratender Personen st√§rker in den Diskurs zu f√ºhren. Dies wurde auch in der gemeinsamen Stellungnahme gefordert, welche w√§hrend unserer Stakeholder-Konferenz (Juni 2018) entstand (http://praediadem.de/).

title: China‚Äôs Green Transformation: Issues, Policies, Prospects
description:
Dr. Hongtao LI (ÊùéÁ∫¢Ê∂õ) is an Associate Professor in the Department of Journalism & Communication and a Distinguished Young Scholar at Zhejiang University. He also serves as an Associate Professor (20%) in the Department of Culture Studies and Oriental Languages at University of Oslo. He received his Ph.D. in Communication from City University of Hong Kong in February 2010. Before joining Zhejiang University in May 2010, he was a post-doctoral fellow and later a visiting Assistant Professor in the Center for Communication Research at City U of Hong Kong. His research interests include air pollution and environmental politics, global communication, sociology of news, media and cultural memory. He has published a book on the mediated memory of Nanjing Massacre (Renmin University Press, 2017) and his work appears regularly on major English and Chinese journals, including The China Quarterly, Communication and the Public, Media, Culture & Society, International Journal of Press/Politics, Asian Journal of Communication, Chinese Journal of Communication, and Communication & Society (in Chinese).

Our video series ‚ÄúChina‚Äôs Green Transformation: Issues, Policies, Prospects‚Äù was filmed on the sidelines of our 2019 lecture series held at the University of G√∂ttingen from April to July 2019. In our conversations with Li Hongtao and Zhang Xuehua we discuss air pollution, media and public participation as well as environmental politics in waste management and recycling. 
https://www.cemeas.de/lecture-series-sose-2019-chinas-green-transformation/

In this video Li Hongtao discusses three questions:
‚ÄúGreen Apps‚Äù are widely used and they play a significant role in dealing with air pollution in China. What is a ‚ÄúGreen App‚Äù and why is it relevant in shaping environmental discourse in China?
‚ÄúEcological Civilization‚Äù is a core concept within Chinese politics. Can you briefly explain it? How does it relate to Chinese society as well as global aspects of environmental protection?
Environmental pollution is one of the major public health concerns in China. In your research, you analyze the role of mass media and social media in framing environmental issues. What are your main findings?

title: Roundtable Brexit Workshop: Where now?
description:
Concluding Roundtable at ‚ÄòBrexit: Causes, Conduct, Consequences‚Äô, an international workshop at the University of G√∂ttingen, 10/11 September 2019.

Participants: Sir Peter Torry, former British amabassador to Germany, Holger Nehring, University of Stirling, Simon Usherwood, University of Surrey, Helene von Bismarck, Independent Scholar, Ed Turner, Aston University and FCO, Andreas Busch, University of G√∂ttingen.

Brexit has been dominating British politics since the summer of 2016, that is for more than three years. As the UK is undergoing perhaps the last extension of the Article 50 procedure, this workshop aimed to take a step back and take a broader view on the process in order to bring the various perspectives on the phenomenon into a dialogue.

In looking at the causes, conduct and consequences of Brexit, we brought together specialists for each of these areas with two goals: to on the one hand obtain a comprehensive picture of the process by which the UK first decided to leave the UK and then tried to implement that decision; on the other hand for the different perspectives to provide a potential for cross-fertilization.

The workshop was organised and funded by the Chair of Comparative Political Economy, Dept. of Political Science, University of G√∂ttingen, Professor Andreas Busch, in cooperation with the G√∂ttingen Academy of Sciences and Humanities.

More information at http://comppol.uni-goettingen.de/brexit_workshop_goe.html

#brexit #unig√∂ttingen

title: Tim Bale: Parties and Party Systems under Stress ‚Äì Brexit Workshop
description:
Tim Bale, Queen Mary University of London, at ‚ÄòBrexit: Causes, Conduct, Consequences‚Äô, an international workshop at University of G√∂ttingen, 10/11 September 2019.

Brexit has been dominating British politics since the summer of 2016, that is for more than three years. As the UK is undergoing perhaps the last extension of the Article 50 procedure, this workshop aimed to take a step back and take a broader view on the process in order to bring the various perspectives on the phenomenon into a dialogue.

In looking at the causes, conduct and consequences of Brexit, we brought together specialists for each of these areas with two goals: to on the one hand obtain a comprehensive picture of the process by which the UK first decided to leave the UK and then tried to implement that decision; on the other hand for the different perspectives to provide a potential for cross-fertilization.

The workshop was organised and funded by the Chair of Comparative Political Economy, Dept. of Political Science, University of G√∂ttingen, Professor Andreas Busch, in cooperation with the G√∂ttingen Academy of Sciences and Humanities.

title: Harald Grethe: Agrarpolitik und Tierhaltung - Ringvorlesung "Tier oder Tofu ‚Äì Was isst die Zukunft?"
description:
Prof. Dr. Harald Grethe, Humboldt-Universit√§t zu Berlin: Agrarpolitik und Tierhaltung. Vortrag im Rahmen der √∂ffentlichen Ringvorlesung "Tier oder Tofu ‚Äì Was isst die Zukunft?" an der Universit√§t G√∂ttingen, gehalten am 19. November 2019 in der Aula am Wilhelmsplatz.

Im Verlauf der letzten 50 Jahre ist der Konsum von Fleisch in vielen L√§ndern rapide angestiegen, der Preis f√ºr Fleisch gleichzeitig stark gesunken. Zugleich wird in der Gesellschaft zunehmend kontrovers √ºber Vegetarier und Vielfleischesser diskutiert. Politisch wird eine Transformation des Agrar- und Ern√§hrungssektors gefordert, insbesondere aus Klima- und Tierschutzgr√ºnden.

Die Ringvorlesung zeigt aus interdisziplin√§rer Perspektive zentrale Facetten dieser Auseinandersetzung um den Konsum tierischer Produkte auf. Ziel ist es, einen wissenschaftlich fundierten Dialog zur Transformation des Ern√§hrungssektors anzuregen. Die Vortr√§ge greifen Fragen nach einer ‚ÄûNachhaltigen Ern√§hrung‚Äú auf, beleuchten Klimaschutz- und Weltern√§hrungsfragen, Anforderungen des Tierschutzes, aber auch ern√§hrungswissenschaftliche und ethische Perspektiven.

Die Vortragenden k√∂nnen zwar die Frage "Tier oder Tofu?" nicht endg√ºltig beantworten, daf√ºr geben sie aber vielf√§ltige Hintergrundinformationen f√ºr fundierte eigene Ern√§hrungsentscheidungen und einen Einblick in den Stand der Nachhaltigkeitsforschung.

title: Towards a New Global Order? Bart Dessein about China‚Äôs Belt and Road Initiative
description:
Bart Dessein is professor at the Department of Chinese language and culture of Ghent University. He obtained his PhD from Ghent University in 1994 with a dissertation on Sarvastivada Buddhist scholasticism. The main research fields of Bart Dessein are the philosophical traditions of South and East Asia. He, more precisely, investigates philosophical developments in early Buddhism (India, Central Asia, China), and the mutual influences the Buddhist tradition and Confucian tradition have had in China. To the latter, investigation in the intellectual and scientific scene in China is connected. 

Bart Dessein has mainly published on early Buddhist philosophy (especially SarvƒÅstivƒÅda and MahƒÅsƒÅ·πÉghika philosophy), Buddhist school formation, and the history of Buddhism in China. More recently, he has also been engaged in research on New Confucianism.
https://research.flw.ugent.be/en/bart.dessein
http://www.eias.org/k_member/bart-dessein/

Our video series ‚ÄúTowards a New Global Order? Ambitions, Scope and Challenges of China‚Äôs Belt and Road Initiative‚Äù was filmed on the sidelines of a workshop held
at the University of G√∂ttingen in June 2019. In our conversations with Fabienne Bossuyt, Maria Danilovich and Bart Dessein we discuss China‚Äôs Belt and Road Initiative (BRI) from the angle of international politics and development assistance, debate its reception in Central Asia as well as its conceptual, philosophical and cultural roots in ancient China. 
https://www.cemeas.de/cemeas-u4-workshop-public-panel-towards-a-new-global-order/

In this video Bart Dessein discusses three questions:
The Belt and Road Initiative (BRI) is China‚Äôs new geopolitical strategy to connect Asia, Europe and Africa. How does it relate to the ancient Silk Road, a trade route that connected the Chinese Empire to the Mediterranean for hundreds of years. 
‚ÄúAll under Heaven ‚Äì Tianxia‚Äù is an ancient concept for world governance, and the center of this world order was the Imperial Court of China. What is the Tianxia conept and does it still play a role in China‚Äôs geopolitical ambitions today?
In the last few decades, China has reemerged as a new global power. How can we as researchers better tackle China‚Äôs new role in the world system?

title: Towards a New Global Order? Maryia Danilovich about China‚Äôs Belt and Road Initiative
description:
Maryia Danilovich is a visiting fellow at the Institute for Russian and Eurasian Studies at Uppsala University. She holds a PhD in history, obtained for her thesis on China‚Äôs Foreign Policy in Central Asia in 2001 ‚Äì 2013. Her background in the Oriental Studies (China Studies) allowed her, as part of her doctoral research, to conduct extensive fieldwork in China and the Central Asian states. As a lecturer, Maryia has been actively teaching courses on the current issues of Eurasian security, contemporary Chinese foreign policy, regional conflicts, and political systems in North-East Asia. 

She is a co-author of the monograph The Shanghai Cooperation Organisation and Central Asia‚Äôs Security Challenges (2013). Her recent publications focus on the implementation of China‚Äôs Belt and Road Initiative (BRI) in Central Asia: The BRI in the Discourses of the Central Asian States (Journal of Chinese Economic and Business Studies 16/3, 2018) and Bridging Westward to Open the Gates of Europe (to be published in a collected volume by the Cambridge University Press).

Maryia‚Äôs research interests focus on China‚Äôs foreign policy in the post-Soviet space.  Her research at the IRES will result in a completion of a monograph on the implementation of China‚Äôs BRI in the Central Asian states and Belarus.
https://www.ires.uu.se/research/previous-visiting-fellows-/guest-researchers-2018-/

Our video series ‚ÄúTowards a New Global Order?
Ambitions, Scope and Challenges of China‚Äôs Belt and Road Initiative‚Äù was filmed on the sidelines of a workshop held at the University of G√∂ttingen in June 2019. In our conversations with Fabienne Bossuyt, Maria Danilovich and Bart Dessein we discuss China‚Äôs Belt and Road Initiative (BRI) from the angle of international politics and development assistance, debate its reception in Central Asia as well as its conceptual, philosophical and cultural roots in ancient China. 
https://www.cemeas.de/cemeas-u4-workshop-public-panel-towards-a-new-global-order/

In this video Maryia Danilovich discusses three questions:
What is the Belt and Road Initiative and how does it affect Eurasian integration?
How can we evaluate China‚Äôs new role in Central Asia? What are possible challenges in the fields of economy and security? How can we evaluate China‚Äôs new role in Central Asia? What are possible challenges in the fields of economy and security?

title: Towards a New Global Order? Fabienne Bossuyt about China‚Äôs Belt and Road Initiative
description:
Fabienne Bossuyt is Assistant Professor at the Centre for EU Studies. She holds a PhD from Aston University (UK) and Ghent University based on a doctoral dissertation on the EU's influence in Post-Soviet Central Asia. Previously, she obtained a Master‚Äôs degree in Translation Studies and a postgraduate degree in International Relations and Conflict Management. She is a lecturer in the MA programme in EU Studies ('Contemporary Issues in EU Politics'; and 'The European Union‚Äôs Neighbourhood Policies'). 

Fabienne Bossuyt is a member of the steering committee of the Russia Platform of Ghent University and is also affiliated to the Centre for Russian International Socio-Political and Economic Studies at UGent.  

Our video series ‚ÄúTowards a New Global Order? Ambitions, Scope and Challenges of China‚Äôs Belt and Road Initiative‚Äù was filmed on the sidelines of a workshop held
at the University of G√∂ttingen in June 2019. In our conversations with Fabienne Bossuyt, Maria Danilovich and Bart Dessein we discuss China‚Äôs Belt and Road Initiative (BRI) from the angle of international politics and development assistance, debate its influence in Central Asia as well as its conceptual, philosophical and cultural roots in ancient China. 

In this video Fabienne Bossuyt discusses three questions:

Launched in 2013, the Belt and Road Initiative (BRI) is China‚Äôs new geopolitical strategy to connect Asia, Europe and Africa. In your research you focus on the New Silk Road that connects China with Europe. What implications does China‚Äôs BRI have on the relations between the EU, Russia and the Central Asian countries?

What are the main opportunities and challenges for the geopolitical rivals Russia, China and the EU along the New Silk Road? How will this shape a new regional order and new norms for the global system?

As part of the BRI, China invests heavily into infrastructure projects in Central Asia. In your research, you compare Chinese und EU developmental assistance in Central Asia. What are your main findings? What impact has China‚Äôs aid on the ground?

title: Mathilda fragt nach(haltig): Sind Tomaten eine Nachhaltigkeitskatastrophe?
description:

Nehmen wir zum Beispiel Tomaten. Macht es einen Unterschied, ob man holl√§ndische oder spanische Tomaten konsumiert? Wie gro√ü ist unser CO2-Fu√üabdruck, wenn es um ganz allt√§gliche Lebensmittel wie Tomaten geht?

Mathilda trifft sich mit Dr. Bernd Horneburg von der Fachgruppe ‚ÄúGenetische Ressourcen und √ñkologische Pflanzenz√ºchtung‚Äù der Universit√§t G√∂ttingen, um mehr √ºber Tomatenproduktion herauszufinden.

Im Forschungsprojekt der Universit√§t G√∂ttingen ‚ÄúPartizipative Entwicklung von Qualit√§tstomaten f√ºr den regionalen Anbau‚Äù (PETRA q+n) werden Tomatensorten entwickelt, die f√ºr den nachhaltigen, regionalen und urbanen Anbau optimal geeignet sind. √úbrigens: Dass wir unseren CO2-Fu√üabdruck reduzieren, ist auch eines der Ziele der Sustainable Development Goals 2030. Diese Ziele wurden von den Vereinten Nationen entwickelt und sollen eine nachhaltige Entwicklung unseres Planeten erm√∂glichen. Mach auch du mit: Denk dr√ºber nach, was auf deinem Teller liegt.

title: Science Me! 2019
description:
17-19 June 2019, Hanover, Germany. Science is exciting! Science is big and Science is fun! During the 2nd edition of Science Me, Science-Show-Teams from all over Europe came together in Hanover during the Ideen Expo 2019.¬´ Science Me! ¬ª, the European Science Show Competition, is aimed at strengthening the dialogue between scientists and the general public. Organized this time around by the Georg-August-University of G√∂ttingen, spectators had the chance to watch entertaining and educational shows.
10-minute presentations in all fields of science or technology consisting of experiments, demonstrations or explanations, given by a maximum of 2 animators, are evaluated by the public and by an independent jury of experts in science and communication. As an essential science dialogue tool, ¬´ Science Me! ¬ª, the European Championship of Science Shows, is an innovative instrument offering to the general audience the possibility to evaluate at the measuring rod of their own sensitivity and understanding. Short presentations in all fields of science or technology are given in a playful and interactive manner.
If you are interested yourself now, check out the videos from the different presentations and of course the final in our channel! And see you at the next Science Me!

Further information at https://www.ideenexpo.de/

title: Round Table: Management von Belastungen bei digitalen Formen der Zusammenarbeit
description:

Margarete Boos vom Georg-Elias-M√ºller-Institut f√ºr Psychologie moderierte den Round Table.

Durch den Einsatz internetbasierter Anwendungen entwickeln sich kollaborative Arbeitsformen, die eine neue Qualit√§t der Zusammenarbeit erm√∂glichen. Unbeabsichtigte Folgen k√∂nnen jedoch eine Erh√∂hung von Stress, Informations-Overload und digitale Ablenkungen sein. Wie kann ein Unternehmen den Einsatz und die Nutzung kollaborativer Anwendungen so managen, dass Belastungen fr√ºhzeitig wahrgenommen und Beanspruchungen gezielt reduziert werden? Worin liegen Gef√§hrdungspotenziale digitaler Zusammenarbeit, und wie k√∂nnen sie identifiziert und entsch√§rft werden? Die Tagung, die am 21. M√§rz 2019 in der Historischen Sternwarte in G√∂ttingen stattfand, thematisierte die M√∂glichkeiten eines gezielten Managements von Belastungen. Gemeinsam wurde dar√ºber diskutiert, wie sich die Potenziale der neuen Arbeitsformen durch eine humanorientierte Arbeitsgestaltung verwirklichen lassen.

Die Fachtagung ist nur ein Bereich der Arbeit des CollaboTeams. In ihrer Arbeit suchen die Mitarbeitenden Antworten f√ºr die Gestaltung kollaborativer Team- und Projektarbeit, um Konzepte und Leitbilder der Arbeitsgestaltung zu entwickeln und zu erproben.

Das Forschungs- und Entwicklungsprojekt CollaboTeam wird im Rahmen des Programms ‚ÄûZukunft der Arbeit‚Äú (F√∂rderkennzeichen 02L15A060) vom Bundesministerium f√ºr Bildung und Forschung (BMBF) sowie dem Europ√§ischen Sozialfonds (ESF) gef√∂rdert und vom Projekttr√§ger Karlsruhe (PTKA) betreut. Die Verantwortung f√ºr den Inhalt dieser Ver√∂ffentlichung liegt bei den Autoren.

description:

title: HASCO Summer School 2019
description:
The main objectives of the hadron collider physics summer school (HASCO) are introductory topics in elementary particle physics, in particular in hadron collider physics as relevant for research at the Large Hadron Collider (LHC). This includes lectures and tutorials on theoretical foundations of the Standard Model of elementary particle physics as well as experimental techniques to test it. Approximately 46 students and 10 lecturers from 15 institutes in Europe, China, USA, Pakistan, India, South Africa and United Arabian Emirates attended the school from 21.7.-26.7.2019 with lectures and tutorials.

More information at http://hasco.uni-goettingen.de

title: Populism and Europe: International Graduate Workshop
description:
From April 11th to 13th an International Graduate Workshop took place in Imshausen. Students and experts from different European universities came together to discuss the topics populism, prejudice, post-truth and European values. This first workshop of an annual workshop series is part of a cooperation between the Adam von Trott Memorial Appeal at Mansfield College in Oxford, the Stiftung Adam von Trott, Imshausen e.V. and the University of G√∂ttingen.
For further information about the workshop click here: http://www.uni-goettingen.de/de/607435.html

The workshop series is part of the project "Resistance - Democracy - Internationality", a cooperation of the University of G√∂ttingen and the Stiftung Adam von Trott, Imshausen e.V. In memory of the G√∂ttingen alumnus and resistance fighter Adam von Trott zu Solz and based on his life, work and thinking, a large number of public events and projects in research and teaching are initiated. The project is sponsored by the Federal Government Commissioner for Culture and the Media.

title: Ausstellung: Ihr wisst mehr, als Ihr denkt
description:

Wenn wir √ºber Wissen reden, denken wir meist an Schule und Universit√§t, an B√ºcher und Experimente. Wissen umfasst jedoch weit mehr. Und es ist nicht nur im Gehirn, sondern im gesamten K√∂rper verankert. Wie aus Wissen und Erfahrung K√∂nnerschaft entsteht, zeigt sich vor allem im Handwerk. Hier f√ºhrt die K√∂nnerschaft sogar regelm√§√üig zu Innovationen. Die Ausstellung veranschaulicht das an zwei Beispielen: dem Orgelbau und dem nachhaltigen Bauen mit Lehm. Besucher*innen k√∂nnen sich davon vor Ort √ºberzeugen: In dem mittelalterlichen Fachwerkhaus erz√§hlen nicht nur die W√§nde von jahrhundertealten Traditionen und √ºberraschenden Neuerungen, auch eine eigens gebaute Orgel bringt den Ausstellungsraum im wahrsten Sinne des Wortes zum Klingen. 

Seit Fr√ºhjahr 2015 geht das Forschungsprojekt OMAHETI (Objekte der K√∂nner ‚Äì Materialisierungen handwerklichen Erfahrungswissen zwischen Tradition und Innovation) dem Zusammenhang von Erfahrungswissen und Innovation in traditionellen Handwerkszweigen nach. Am Beispiel von Orgel- und Lehmbau vermittelt die Ausstellung Forschungsergebnisse und regt zur gesellschaftlichen Wertsch√§tzung von Wissen und K√∂nnen an.

Die Ausstellung entstand in enger Zusammenarbeit mit der Zentralen Kustodie und den Sammlungen der Universit√§t G√∂ttingen; sie wirft einen Blick voraus auf das zuk√ºnftige Forum Wissen.

title: Zauberhafte Physik: Das Franck-Hertz-Experiment
description:
James Franck und Gustav Hertz haben 1913 ein Schl√ºsselexperiment der experimentellen Quantenmechanik durchgef√ºhrt. Sie haben ein Quecksilber-Gas mit Elektronen bei steigender Beschleunigungsspannung beschossen und dabei Lichtph√§nomene sowie Schwankungen im Stromfluss durch das Gas beobachtet. Die Interpretation der beiden Beobachtungen ist, dass Elektronen in Atomen nur in bestimmten Bindungszust√§ndigen mit diskreten Energieniveaus gebunden werden k√∂nnen. F√ºr dieses Schl√ºsselexperiment erhielten sie 1925 den Physik-Nobelpreis.
Der Clip veranschaulicht das Ph√§nomen und erl√§utert die Zusammenh√§nge. Er entstand im Rahmen des Seminars "Vermittlung wissenschaftlicher Zusammenh√§nge durch neue Medien".

title: GlobalFood: Are we willing to pay more for fair trade products?
description:
Many companies provide fair trade labelled products, but not a lot of people buy them. Why is that? To answer that question the Research Training Group (RTG) ‚ÄúGlobalFood‚Äù focusses its research on understanding what motivates people to buy fair trade products, and how these motivations vary across different consumers‚Äô groups. Being able to do so will facilitate and encourage the selling of more fair trade products, which will have a positive impact on poor farmers.

The research is done by using real transactions of coffee purchases, and using it to reveal unobserved consumer characteristics and differences in behavior.

You can find more information about the Research Training Group (RTG) ‚ÄúGlobalFood‚Äù and the speaker in this video, Mahmoud Ahmed, here: https://www.uni-goettingen.de/en/562753.html

Professor Wadad Kadi, Avalon Foundation Distinguished Service Professor (Emerita) of Islamic Studies at the University of Chicago, addresses this question in her keynote lecture. Miskawayh's reflections focused on the concept of  øƒÅmma (the general public or majority of the population) and ·∏´ƒÅ·π£·π£a (the elites) in the social context of classical Islam. 

Professor Wadad Kadi gave the keynote lecture at the international symposium "Islamic Ethics as Educational Discourse: Thought and Impact of the Classical Muslim Thinker Miskawayh (d. 1030)". It took place from May 24 to 27 (2018) at the University of G√∂ttingen as a cooperation project of Professor Sebastian G√ºnther, Chair of Arabic and Islamic Studies at the University of G√∂ttingen, and Dr Yassir El Jamouhi, postdoc in the Collaborative Research Centre 1136 "Education and Religion" also based here.

title: Global Food: Certified cocoa - better access to the market?
description:
In recent years, the number of private food standards has increased tremendously. Since these affect import and exports decisions, the analysis of trade effects of such standards has become an important topic. However, most empirical studies have focussed on food safety standards. We are analysing the trade effect of a sustainability standard, specifically Rainforest Alliance Certified. 

This is especially relevant in the cocoa sector, because big chocolate manufacturers committed themselves to only use certified cocoa beans and some governments want to increase the share of certified cocoa products consumed in their countries. Thus, sustainability certification becomes quasi-mandatory for cocoa producers to ensure market access. The question arising here is whether sustainability certification additionally enhances market access or it rather maintains existing trade relationships? 

Research Training Group ‚ÄúGlobalFood‚Äù and Nina Grassnick https://www.uni-goettingen.de/de/560847.html

title: GlobalFood: How mobile phones increase trust in rural Kenya
description:
Would you buy something from a person whom you absolutely do not trust? Probably not. Basic levels of trust are essential for productive economic interactions. Many societies in rural Africa however have relatively little trust, especially towards unknown strangers. This holds true also for semi-nomadic pastoralists in Northern Kenya. The scarcity of trust in this society is among others caused by low institutional quality and high monitoring costs. Remarkably, mobile phones can be very useful in this matter. 
Research Training Group ‚ÄúGlobalFood‚Äù and Martin Parlasa http://www.uni-goettingen.de/de/560854.html 

Although the link between mobile phones and trust does not seem very intuitive at first, it can be explained by two main mechanisms. First, mobile phones facilitate the communication of two people, especially when they are far away from each other. Using the phone, a person can quickly and at low costs verify if the other person meets previously made agreements, which mitigates the threat of being cheated by the other person. This way, mobile phones can enhance trust between two persons, so called personalized trust. 

Personalized trust however needs to be established for every buyer-seller-pair. This can be cumbersome and leads to a limited reach of efficient market participation. Socially more efficient and therefore economically relevant is generalized trust, which refers to trust towards other, not necessarily known people or groups. We found out that mobile phones can also increase this important generalized trust: mobile phones facilitate the communication with people from different social groups, which live farther away and are more socially distant. Through such communication, people learn more about motives, beliefs, upbringings, attitudes, or social norms of persons from these socially distant groups. This knowledge is however not limited to the specific person, with whom communication occurs, but transferred to the entire group.

This increase in information and knowledge then translates into higher trust towards people from this group in general. If a phone using pastoralist now meets people from that group for the first time, he or she can build upon this trust to enable productive economic interaction.

title: GlobalFood: How do farmers learn best about sustainable farming?
description:
Low levels of agricultural productivity, reduced soil fertility and severe land degradation present threats for the food security as well as the environmental situation in many Sub-Saharan African countries. This calls for strategies towards a more sustainable agricultural development. The aim of this project is to investigate the effects of methods to educate smallholder farmers in Ethiopia on a technology called Integrated Soil Fertility Management (ISMF). The core of ISFM is the combined use of organic and inorganic soil amendments as a strategy to increase soil fertility and productivity, while at the same time tackling land degradation. 

In order to disseminate information on ISFM and to spur its adoption, new approaches for farmer education were implemented and tested within the rigorous experimental design of a Randomized Controlled Trial (RCT). Firstly, the effects of a participatory extension approach based on model farmers, agricultural learning groups and demonstration plots are tested. In addition, we assess the effectiveness of video as a complementary method. The study is conducted within the ISFM+ project of the German Corporation for International Cooperation (GIZ) in the Ethiopian highlands. 

More information about the Research Training Group (RTG) ‚ÄúGlobalFood‚Äù and Denise H√∂rner
https://www.uni-goettingen.de/en/542522.html

title: GlobalFood: Buy good, feel good?
description:
Food products with ethical claims are stacked on supermarket shelves in ever increasing numbers, but their share of total food sales does not usually climb above a one-digit figure. Numerous consumer studies have investigated the motives of consumers to purchase food items with ethical claims, as well as the potential purchase barriers. With our studies, we merge these insights with the concept of the warm glow of giving, which originates from public good theory, as we enlist food items with ethical claims as private goods with public good characteristics. 

The warm glow of giving reflects personal gain from an act of altruism. How does the the warm glow influence the intention purchase food items with ethical claims and the actual food choice? Results from a choice experiment and an experimental online auction give first insights. 

More information about the Research Training Group (RTG) ‚ÄúGlobalFood‚Äù https://www.uni-goettingen.de/en/511470.html

title: Improving Agricultural Education in Tajikistan
description:
Project presentation by Wim Hoste, Ghent University: Improving Agricultural Education in Tajikistan. Project presentation at the Sustainability Conference 2018 "Education for Sustainable Development - 'Education' for Sustainable Development" on 23rd and 24th November 2018 at the University of G√∂ttingen. 

The conference deals with the concept of sustainability, prepares goals and approaches and offers a forum to exchange views on opportunities and challenges of Education for Sustainable Development. Among others the following questions will be addressed: How should education deal with conflicting objectives of the various dimensions of sustainable development? How can we enable an interdisciplinary and holistic view of problems and approaches? How do we move from knowledge to action? Central suggestions come from the partner universities of the U4 network (Uppsala, Ghent, Groningen). The focus is on digitisation, early childhood education, teacher training and the role of sustainability at universities

Further information available here: http://www.uni-goettingen.de/de/589423.html

title: GlobalFood: Does contract farming help farmers?
description:
In this research project, we are investigating the effects of contract farming in the oil palm sector in Ghana. Contrary to the existing literature, we are investigating differences across types of contracts. The cross-contract comparison includes simple marketing contracts, that provide farmers with a secure market and resource-providing contracts under which farmers additionally receive production inputs and services through in-kind credits. 

More about Anette Ruml, PhD candidate at GlobalFood: https://www.uni-goettingen.de/en/560855.html

title: The University and Sustainability
description:
Lecture by Prof. Dr. Eva √Ökesson, President of Uppsala University, and Prof. Dr. Anna Rutgersson, Uppsala University: The University and Sustainability. Lecture at the Sustainability Conference 2018 "Bildung f√ºr Nachhaltige Entwicklung - 'Education' for Sustainable Development" on 23rd and 24th November 2018 at the University of G√∂ttingen.

The conference deals with the concept of sustainability, prepares objectives and approaches of education for sustainable development and provides a forum for exchanging views on the opportunities and challenges of education for sustainable development. Among other things, the following questions will be examined: How should education deal with the conflicting goals of the various dimensions of sustainable development? How can we provide an interdisciplinary and holistic view of problems and approaches for solutions? How do we get from knowledge to action? Central suggestions come from the partner universities of the U4 network (Uppsala, Gent, Groningen). The conference focus is on digitisation, early childhood education, teacher training and the role of sustainability at universities. 

Further information can be found here: http://www.uni-goettingen.de/de/589423.html

title: GlobalFood: Learning in groups fuels technology adoption
description:
Dr. Lisa J√§ckering did her PhD in the Agriculture and Dietary Diversity in Africa (ADDA) project. The aim of this project is to improve the knowledge on agriculture-nutrition linkages in the African small farm sector, and to develop approaches how the uptake of pro-nutrition innovations can be promoted. New models of nutrition-sensitive extension are developed, tested, and compared through randomized controlled trials (RCTs) and rigorous impact assessment in Kenya. In particular, Lisa focuses on the important role of social networks for the adoption of new technologies.

More information about the Research Training Group (RTG) ‚ÄúGlobalFood‚Äù https://www.uni-goettingen.de/en/511470.html

title: Schlusswort zur Ringvorlesung
description:
Prof. Dr.  Peter Gemeinhardt,  Kirchengeschichte, G√∂ttingen:  Schlusswort im Rahmen der √∂ffentlichen Ringvorlesung "Verstehst du auch, was du liest? Debatten √ºber Heilige Texte in Orient und Okzident" an der Universit√§t G√∂ttingen, gehalten am 29. Januar 2019 in der Historischen Staats- und Universit√§tsbibliothek G√∂ttingen, Paulinerkirche. 

Mit der Entstehung und Entwicklung von Kulturen und Religionen auf das Engste verbunden sind autoritative religi√∂se Texte, die gemeinhin als ‚ÄûHeilige‚Äú Schriften bezeichnet werden. Diese schriftlichen (oder auch m√ºndlichen) Textzeugnisse enthalten Ideen, die nicht nur f√ºr Fragen des Glaubens, sondern auch f√ºr das Miteinander der Menschen insgesamt bis heute wichtig sind. Zugleich stellen sie einen ‚ÄûKanon der Bildung‚Äú f√ºr diejenigen Personen dar, die sich zu der betreffenden Kultur oder Religion bekennen.

Welches Publikum sprechen diese Texte an? Bedurfte es eines ausgebildeten Lehrers f√ºr ihr Verst√§ndnis? Oder inwiefern erfolgte ihre Deutung durch Laien? Was passierte, wenn das gelehrte Wissen nicht verstanden wurde? Welche Debatten zum Textverst√§ndnis ergaben sich innerhalb der Religionsgemeinschaften, und welche Rolle spielten diese Texte in der Auseinandersetzung mit anderen Kulturen und Religionen? 

Diese und weitere Fragen greift die Ringvorlesung f√ºr verschiedene geographische R√§ume, Zeiten und Kulturen auf. Getragen wird die Vortragsreihe vom Sonderforschungsbereich ‚ÄûBildung und Religion‚Äú der Georg-August-Universit√§t G√∂ttingen.

Weitere Informationen sind unter https://www.uni-goettingen.de/de/5712... zu finden.

Black holes, a sandbox in which you can move mountains, cuneiform writing and much more - over 25,000 visitors came to the 4th Night of Science at the G√∂ttingen Campus. We went around with the camera and asked some night owls for their impressions.

title: Debatten um die Heiligen Schriften im orientalischen Christentum
description:
Prof. Dr. Heike Behlmer, √Ñgyptologie und Koptologie, und Prof. Dr. Martin Tamcke, √ñkumenische Theologie, G√∂ttingen: "Debatten um die Heiligen Schriften im orientalischen Christentum". Vortrag im Rahmen der √∂ffentlichen Ringvorlesung "Verstehst du auch, was du liest? Debatten √ºber Heilige Texte in Orient und Okzident" an der Universit√§t G√∂ttingen, gehalten am 15. Januar 2019 in der Historischen Staats- und Universit√§tsbibliothek G√∂ttingen, Paulinerkirche. 

Mit der Entstehung und Entwicklung von Kulturen und Religionen auf das Engste verbunden sind autoritative religi√∂se Texte, die gemeinhin als ‚ÄûHeilige‚Äú Schriften bezeichnet werden. Diese schriftlichen (oder auch m√ºndlichen) Textzeugnisse enthalten Ideen, die nicht nur f√ºr Fragen des Glaubens, sondern auch f√ºr das Miteinander der Menschen insgesamt bis heute wichtig sind. Zugleich stellen sie einen ‚ÄûKanon der Bildung‚Äú f√ºr diejenigen Personen dar, die sich zu der betreffenden Kultur oder Religion bekennen.

Welches Publikum sprechen diese Texte an? Bedurfte es eines ausgebildeten Lehrers f√ºr ihr Verst√§ndnis? Oder inwiefern erfolgte ihre Deutung durch Laien? Was passierte, wenn das gelehrte Wissen nicht verstanden wurde? Welche Debatten zum Textverst√§ndnis ergaben sich innerhalb der Religionsgemeinschaften, und welche Rolle spielten diese Texte in der Auseinandersetzung mit anderen Kulturen und Religionen? 

Diese und weitere Fragen greift die Ringvorlesung f√ºr verschiedene geographische R√§ume, Zeiten und Kulturen auf. Getragen wird die Vortragsreihe vom Sonderforschungsbereich ‚ÄûBildung und Religion‚Äú der Georg-August-Universit√§t G√∂ttingen.

Weitere Informationen sind unter https://www.uni-goettingen.de/de/5712... zu finden.

title: PiA - Physics in Advent 2018 - Kettenreaktion / chain reaction
description:
You call it playing, we call it experimenting!

With "PiA - Physics in Advent" we have developed an Advent calendar of a special kind: a physics Advent calendar. We present 24 small simple experiments and physical puzzles to young researchers and all those who enjoy it. They are intended to awaken the joy of experimenting or to create excitement while watching. 

Every day from December 1 to December 24, 2018, a video clip will present an experiment that you can do yourself with household-type material. On the website you can then answer the questions during the day. The solution of the physical question raised in the experiment will also be given via video the next day. At the end there will be prizes for the best answers from individuals, school classes or whole schools. Join in! 

"PiA - Physics in Advent" is offered in cooperation with the Georg-August-Universit√§t G√∂ttingen, the Wilhelm und Else Heraeus-Stiftung, the German Physical Society (DPG), the Austrian Physical Society (√ñPG), the Swiss Physical Society (SPS) as well as the European Physical Society (EPS). 

Further information can be found at: 
https://www.physics-in-advent.org 
https://www.facebook.com/PhysikImAdvent 
https://twitter.com/PhysikImAdvent 
https://twitter.com/PhysicsInAdvent 
https://www.instagram.com/physikimadvent 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 

Ihr nennt es Spielen, wir nennen es Experimentieren! 

Mit "PiA - Physik im Advent" haben wir einen Adventskalender der besonderen Art entwickelt: einen physikalischen Adventskalender. Darin stellen wir Jungforscherinnen, Jungforschern und allen, die daran Spa√ü haben, 24 kleine einfache Experimente und physikalische R√§tsel vor. Sie sollen die Freude am Selber-Experimentieren wecken oder f√ºr Spannung beim Zuschauen sorgen. 

Vom 1. bis zum 24. Dezember 2018 wird jeden Tag per Video-Clip ein Experiment vorgestellt, das Ihr nachmachen k√∂nnt. Auf der Webseite k√∂nnt Ihr anschlie√üend die Fragen im Laufe des Tages beantworten. Die Aufl√∂sung der in dem Experiment aufgeworfenen physikalischen Frage erfolgt am n√§chsten Tag ebenfalls per Video. Am Ende gibt es Preise f√ºr die besten Antworten von Einzelpersonen, Schulklassen oder ganze Schulen. Macht mit! 

"PiA - Physik im Advent" wird von der Georg-August-Universit√§t G√∂ttingen, der Wilhelm und Else Heraeus-Stiftung, der Deutschen Physikalische Gesellschaft (DPG), der √ñsterreichischen Physikalischen Gesellschaft (√ñPG), der Schweizer Physikalischen Gesellschaft (SPS) sowie der Europ√§ischen Physikalischen Gesellschaft (EPS) als Kooperationspartner unterst√ºtzt. Weitere Informationen unter: 
http://www.physik-im-advent.de 
http://www.facebook.com/PhysikImAdvent 
https://twitter.com/PhysikImAdvent 
https://twitter.com/PhysicsInAdvent 
https://www.instagram.com/physikimadvent

With "PiA - Physics in Advent" we have developed an Advent calendar of a special kind: a physics Advent calendar. We present 24 small simple experiments and physical puzzles to young researchers and all those who enjoy it. They are intended to awaken the joy of experimenting or to create excitement while watching. 

Every day from December 1 to December 24, 2018, a video clip will present an experiment that you can do yourself with household-type material. On the website you can then answer the questions during the day. The solution of the physical question raised in the experiment will also be given via video the next day. At the end there will be prizes for the best answers from individuals, school classes or whole schools. Join in! 

"PiA - Physics in Advent" is offered in cooperation with the Georg-August-Universit√§t G√∂ttingen, the Wilhelm und Else Heraeus-Stiftung, the German Physical Society (DPG), the Austrian Physical Society (√ñPG), the Swiss Physical Society (SPS) as well as the European Physical Society (EPS). 

Further information can be found at: 
https://www.physics-in-advent.org 
https://www.facebook.com/PhysikImAdvent 
https://twitter.com/PhysikImAdvent 
https://twitter.com/PhysicsInAdvent 
https://www.instagram.com/physikimadvent 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 

Ihr nennt es Spielen, wir nennen es Experimentieren! 

Mit "PiA - Physik im Advent" haben wir einen Adventskalender der besonderen Art entwickelt: einen physikalischen Adventskalender. Darin stellen wir Jungforscherinnen, Jungforschern und allen, die daran Spa√ü haben, 24 kleine einfache Experimente und physikalische R√§tsel vor. Sie sollen die Freude am Selber-Experimentieren wecken oder f√ºr Spannung beim Zuschauen sorgen. 

Vom 1. bis zum 24. Dezember 2018 wird jeden Tag per Video-Clip ein Experiment vorgestellt, das Ihr nachmachen k√∂nnt. Auf der Webseite k√∂nnt Ihr anschlie√üend die Fragen im Laufe des Tages beantworten. Die Aufl√∂sung der in dem Experiment aufgeworfenen physikalischen Frage erfolgt am n√§chsten Tag ebenfalls per Video. Am Ende gibt es Preise f√ºr die besten Antworten von Einzelpersonen, Schulklassen oder ganze Schulen. Macht mit! 

"PiA - Physik im Advent" wird von der Georg-August-Universit√§t G√∂ttingen, der Wilhelm und Else Heraeus-Stiftung, der Deutschen Physikalische Gesellschaft (DPG), der √ñsterreichischen Physikalischen Gesellschaft (√ñPG), der Schweizer Physikalischen Gesellschaft (SPS) sowie der Europ√§ischen Physikalischen Gesellschaft (EPS) als Kooperationspartner unterst√ºtzt. Weitere Informationen unter: 
http://www.physik-im-advent.de 
http://www.facebook.com/PhysikImAdvent 
https://twitter.com/PhysikImAdvent 
https://twitter.com/PhysicsInAdvent 
https://www.instagram.com/physikimadvent

title: PiA - Physik im Advent 2018 - Aufgabe 10
description:
You call it playing, we call it experimenting!

With "PiA - Physics in Advent" we have developed an Advent calendar of a special kind: a physics Advent calendar. We present 24 small simple experiments and physical puzzles to young researchers and all those who enjoy it. They are intended to awaken the joy of experimenting or to create excitement while watching. 

Every day from December 1 to December 24, 2018, a video clip will present an experiment that you can do yourself with household-type material. On the website you can then answer the questions during the day. The solution of the physical question raised in the experiment will also be given via video the next day. At the end there will be prizes for the best answers from individuals, school classes or whole schools. Join in! 

"PiA - Physics in Advent" is offered in cooperation with the Georg-August-Universit√§t G√∂ttingen, the Wilhelm und Else Heraeus-Stiftung, the German Physical Society (DPG), the Austrian Physical Society (√ñPG), the Swiss Physical Society (SPS) as well as the European Physical Society (EPS).

Sie sollen die Freude am Selber-Experimentieren wecken oder f√ºr Spannung beim Zuschauen sorgen. 

Vom 1. bis zum 24. Dezember 2018 wird jeden Tag per Video-Clip ein Experiment vorgestellt, das Ihr nachmachen k√∂nnt. Auf der Webseite k√∂nnt Ihr anschlie√üend die Fragen im Laufe des Tages beantworten. title: Der Koran: Die Heilige Schrift der Muslime
description:
Prof. Dr. Angelika Neuwirth, Arabistik und Islamwissenschaft, Berlin: "Der Koran: Die Heilige Schrift der Muslime und die Debatten zwischen Islam, Judentum und Christentum im Kontext der Sp√§tantike". Vortrag im Rahmen der √∂ffentlichen Ringvorlesung "Verstehst du auch, was du liest? Debatten √ºber Heilige Texte in Orient und Okzident" an der Universit√§t G√∂ttingen, gehalten am 18. Dezember 2018 in der Historischen Staats- und Universit√§tsbibliothek G√∂ttingen, Paulinerkirche. 

Mit der Entstehung und Entwicklung von Kulturen und Religionen auf das Engste verbunden sind autoritative religi√∂se Texte, die gemeinhin als ‚ÄûHeilige‚Äú Schriften bezeichnet werden. Diese schriftlichen (oder auch m√ºndlichen) Textzeugnisse enthalten Ideen, die nicht nur f√ºr Fragen des Glaubens, sondern auch f√ºr das Miteinander der Menschen insgesamt bis heute wichtig sind. Zugleich stellen sie einen ‚ÄûKanon der Bildung‚Äú f√ºr diejenigen Personen dar, die sich zu der betreffenden Kultur oder Religion bekennen.

Welches Publikum sprechen diese Texte an? Bedurfte es eines ausgebildeten Lehrers f√ºr ihr Verst√§ndnis? Oder inwiefern erfolgte ihre Deutung durch Laien? Was passierte, wenn das gelehrte Wissen nicht verstanden wurde? Welche Debatten zum Textverst√§ndnis ergaben sich innerhalb der Religionsgemeinschaften, und welche Rolle spielten diese Texte in der Auseinandersetzung mit anderen Kulturen und Religionen? 

Diese und weitere Fragen greift die Ringvorlesung f√ºr verschiedene geographische R√§ume, Zeiten und Kulturen auf. Getragen wird die Vortragsreihe vom Sonderforschungsbereich ‚ÄûBildung und Religion‚Äú der Georg-August-Universit√§t G√∂ttingen.

Weitere Informationen sind unter https://www.uni-goettingen.de/de/5712... zu finden.

title: Teambuilding in den Wildalpen
description:
Das Betriebliche Gesundheitsmanagement setzt neue Impulse f√ºr die Besch√§ftigten der Universit√§t G√∂ttingen. Zum Programm geh√∂rt auch "Move! Team Power + Team Spirit". Ob Wildwasserkanu, Klettern oder Bergsteigen - die gemeinsame Bewegung f√∂rdert das Team und jeden einzelnen. Mehr Schwung und R√ºcksichtnahme, Zusammenhalt und Kollegialit√§t! Die erste Tour in die Wildalpen hat das Betriebliche Gesundheitssystem mit der Kamera begleitet!

Neben Angeboten zur individuellen Gesundheitsf√∂rderung unterst√ºtzt das Betriebliche Gesundheitsmanagement die Teamentwicklung auch mit Ideen f√ºr Betriebsausfl√ºge, mit Aktiv-Tagen und Outdoor-Trainings. 

Weitere Informationen gibt es unter http://www.uni-goettingen.de/de/angebote+des+bgm/520807.html

title: Daten Lesen Lernen
description:
Mit diesem Projekt m√∂chte die Universit√§t G√∂ttingen die Datenkompetenz aller Studierenden f√∂rdern. Bereits im Bachelorstudium sollen diese unabh√§ngig vom Fach den Umgang mit digitalen Daten erlernen k√∂nnen.

Als forschungsstarker Verbund universit√§rer und universit√§tsnaher Forschungsinstitutionen arbeitet der G√∂ttingen Campus federf√ºhrend an der Entwicklung im Bereich Data Science mit. Im Zuge des Projektes "Daten Lesen Lernen" sollen die vorhandenen Kompetenzen und infrastrukturellen Ressourcen genutzt werden, um Datenkompetenzen im gesamten G√∂ttingen Campus zu verankern. 

F√ºr dieses Projekt erhielt die Universit√§t G√∂ttingen im Rahmen des Wettbewerbes ‚ÄûData Literacy Education‚Äú den Preis des Stifterverbandes und der Heinz Nixdorf Stiftung.

description:

title: Was der Heliumschweif des Exoplaneten verr√§t
description:
Die Animation zeigt eine k√ºnstlerische Impression des extrasolaren Gasplaneten namens WASP-69b. Angetrieben durch die Strahlung seines Zentralsterns, der im Hintergrund zu sehen ist, entweicht Helium aus der Atmosph√§re des Planeten. Daraus entsteht ein kometen√§hnlicher Schweif, den er hinter sich herzieht. 

Mehr dazu in unserer Pressemitteilung http://www.uni-goettingen.de/de/3240.html?id=5260

Credits: Gabriel Perez Diaz, Instituto de Astrofisica de Canarias

title: Der Umgang mit der Heiligen Schrift bei Paulus und Lukas
description:
Prof. Dr. Reinhard Feldmeier (vertreten durch Jan Basczok) und Prof. Dr. Florian Wilk, Neues Testament, G√∂ttingen "Zwischen H√∂ren und Deuten. Der Umgang mit der Heiligen Schrift in den Briefen des Paulus und im Doppelwerk des Lukas". Vortrag im Rahmen der √∂ffentlichen Ringvorlesung "Verstehst du auch, was du liest? Debatten √ºber Heilige Texte in Orient und Okzident" an der Universit√§t G√∂ttingen, gehalten am 30. Oktober 2018 in der Historischen Staats- und Universit√§tsbibliothek G√∂ttingen, Paulinerkirche. 

Mit der Entstehung und Entwicklung von Kulturen und Religionen auf das Engste verbunden sind autoritative religi√∂se Texte, die gemeinhin als ‚ÄûHeilige‚Äú Schriften bezeichnet werden. Diese schriftlichen (oder auch m√ºndlichen) Textzeugnisse enthalten Ideen, die nicht nur f√ºr Fragen des Glaubens, sondern auch f√ºr das Miteinander der Menschen insgesamt bis heute wichtig sind. Zugleich stellen sie einen ‚ÄûKanon der Bildung‚Äú f√ºr diejenigen Personen dar, die sich zu der betreffenden Kultur oder Religion bekennen. 

Welches Publikum sprechen diese Texte an? Bedurfte es eines ausgebildeten Lehrers f√ºr ihr Verst√§ndnis? Oder inwiefern erfolgte ihre Deutung durch Laien? Was passierte, wenn das gelehrte Wissen nicht verstanden wurde? Welche Debatten zum Textverst√§ndnis ergaben sich innerhalb der Religionsgemeinschaften, und welche Rolle spielten diese Texte in der Auseinandersetzung mit anderen Kulturen und Religionen? 

Diese und weitere Fragen greift die Ringvorlesung f√ºr verschiedene geographische R√§ume, Zeiten und Kulturen auf. Getragen wird die Vortragsreihe vom Sonderforschungsbereich ‚ÄûBildung und Religion‚Äú der Georg-August-Universit√§t G√∂ttingen. 

Weitere Informationen sind unter https://www.uni-goettingen.de/de/5712 zu finden.

title: PiA - Physik im Advent 2018 - Aufgabe 03
description:
You call it playing, we call it experimenting!

With "PiA - Physics in Advent" we have developed an Advent calendar of a special kind: a physics Advent calendar. We present 24 small simple experiments and physical puzzles to young researchers and all those who enjoy it. They are intended to awaken the joy of experimenting or to create excitement while watching. 

Every day from December 1 to December 24, 2018, a video clip will present an experiment that you can do yourself with household-type material. On the website you can then answer the questions during the day. The solution of the physical question raised in the experiment will also be given via video the next day. At the end there will be prizes for the best answers from individuals, school classes or whole schools. Join in! 

"PiA - Physics in Advent" is offered in cooperation with the Georg-August-Universit√§t G√∂ttingen, the Wilhelm und Else Heraeus-Stiftung, the German Physical Society (DPG), the Austrian Physical Society (√ñPG), the Swiss Physical Society (SPS) as well as the European Physical Society (EPS).

title: Panel Discussion ‚Äì Breeding and Society
description:
Panel Discussion about ‚ÄúBreeding and Society‚Äù. Representatives from academia and industry discuss the influence and role of breeders and breeding research on society and how the dialogue and the relation between research and society can be improved.

Dr L√©on Broers, KWS Saat SE
Professor Urs Niggli, Research Institute of Organic Agriculture, FiBL
Professor Senja Post, University of G√∂ttingen
Professor Henner Simianer, University of G√∂ttingen
Chair: Professor Achim Spiller, University of G√∂ttingen

The conference "Plants and Animals: Bridging the Gap in Breeding Research" (10/11 Oct 2018) aims to highlight commonalities and differences between plant and animal breeding. Innovative research fields will be presented. The added vaue of intergrated breeding research across crops, trees, and livestock will be discussed.

The Center for Integrated Breeding Research at the University of G√∂ttingen brings together the expertise of plant and animal breeding with findings from natural and social sciences in order to establish an internationally visible position in this field. 

More information https://www.uni-goettingen.de/en/531395.html

title: Conflicting views on breeding
description:
Senja Post, Professor of Life Sciences Communication at the University of Goettingen, about "Conflicting views on breeding ‚Äì Why do public perceptions and scientific knowledge differ?"
Different members of society hold differing views on breeding. Scepticism towards new technologies is widespread and a dialogue is hard because people tend to stick to their opinion. Watch Senja Post explain how different groups of people engage in motivated reasoning and why this is a problem for science.

The conference "Plants and Animals: Bridging the Gap in Breeding Research" (10/11 Oct 2018) aims to highlight commonalities and differences between plant and animal breeding. Innovative research fields will be presented. The added vaue of intergrated breeding research across crops, trees, and livestock will be discussed.

The Center for Integrated Breeding Research at the University of G√∂ttingen brings together the expertise of plant and animal breeding with findings from natural and social sciences in order to establish an internationally visible position in this field. 

More information https://www.uni-goettingen.de/en/531395.html

title: Genomics-enabled breeding for forest resilience
description:
John E. Carlson, Professor of Molecular Genetics at the Pennsylvania State University and Director of The Schatz Center for Tree Molecular Genetics, about "Genomics-enabled breeding for forest resilience". Due to the long generation time, improving trees is a special challenge. Issues and approaches for forest tree improvement, the challenges of sustainability, and the roles for genomics in addressing forest health are presented here by John E. Carlson.

The conference "Plants and Animals: Bridging the Gap in Breeding Research" (10/11 Oct 2018) aims to highlight commonalities and differences between plant and animal breeding. Innovative research fields will be presented. The added vaue of intergrated breeding research across crops, trees, and livestock will be discussed.

The Center for Integrated Breeding Research at the University of G√∂ttingen brings together the expertise of plant and animal breeding with findings from natural and social sciences in order to establish an internationally visible position in this field. 

More information https://www.uni-goettingen.de/en/531395.html

title: R2, H2 and the importance of pairwise differences
description:
Hans Peter Piepho, Professor of Biostatistics at the University of Hohenheim, about "R2, H2 and the importance of pairwise differences". How should experiments be designed to deliver efficient data to study heritability? Should environmental data be random or fixed? And which analysis is appropriate for which kind of design? Which coefficients should be used to assess the story our data tell us? Listen how Piepho tackles all these questions in his talk.

The conference "Plants and Animals: Bridging the Gap in Breeding Research" (10/11 Oct 2018) aims to highlight commonalities and differences between plant and animal breeding. Innovative research fields will be presented. The added vaue of intergrated breeding research across crops, trees, and livestock will be discussed.

The Center for Integrated Breeding Research at the University of G√∂ttingen brings together the expertise of plant and animal breeding with findings from natural and social sciences in order to establish an internationally visible position in this field. 

More information https://www.uni-goettingen.de/en/531395.html

title: Identifying selection on complex traits in maize, chickens, and beyond
description:
Tim Beissinger, Professor of Plant Sciences at the University of Missouri, about "Identifying selection on complex traits in maize, chickens, and beyond". How does selection work on quantitative traits? How can we find it using genomic data? Can we determine traits that were previously under selection? Answering those questions Beissinger presents his new method to test for polygenetic selection in breeding populations.

The conference "Plants and Animals: Bridging the Gap in Breeding Research" (10/11 Oct 2018) aims to highlight commonalities and differences between plant and animal breeding. Innovative research fields will be presented. The added vaue of intergrated breeding research across crops, trees, and livestock will be discussed.

The Center for Integrated Breeding Research at the University of G√∂ttingen brings together the expertise of plant and animal breeding with findings from natural and social sciences in order to establish an internationally visible position in this field.

title: Feeding the world with big data
description:
Kristian Kersting, Professor of Machine Learning at the Computer Science Department of the TU Darmstadt, about "Feeding the world with big data: machines uncover spectral characteristics and dynamics of stressed plants".

Kersting gives an example on how machines can be trained to detect properties faster than humans can, all the while maintaining biological meaning of all model parameters. He shows how machine learning and deep learning approaches can be combined to train a computer to develop predictions on and simulations of traits just from a bunch of oberservational data.

description:
Dr Clemens Falker-Gieske from the Functional Breeding Lab of the University of G√∂ttingen about "GWAS for meat and carcass traits using imputed sequence level genotypes in pooled F2-designs in pigs". The identification of short chromosomal regions harbouring causal mutations of quantitative traits becomes more and more important in pig breeding. Listen how Falker-Gieske wants to improve the use of GWAS on SNP chip data to implement a new method that yields smaller LD blocks and high mapping resolution.

description:

title: Physics in Advent - PiA 2018
description:
You call it playing, we call it experimenting! 

With "PiA - Physics in Advent" we have developed an Advent calendar of a special kind: a physics Advent calendar. We present 24 small simple experiments and physical puzzles to young researchers and all those who enjoy it. They are intended to awaken the joy of experimenting or to create excitement while watching. Every day from December 1 to December 24, 2018, a video clip will present an experiment that you can do yourself with household-type material. On the website you can then answer the questions during the day. The solution of the physical question raised in the experiment will also be given via video the next day. At the end there will be prizes for the best answers from individuals, school classes or whole schools. Join in! 

"PiA - Physics in Advent" is offered in cooperation with the Georg-August-Universit√§t G√∂ttingen, the Wilhelm und Else Heraeus-Stiftung, the German Physical Society (DPG), the Austrian Physical Society (√ñPG), the Swiss Physical Society (SPS) as well as the European Physical Society (EPS).

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 

Physics in Advent - PiA: You call it playing, we call it experimenting. 

With "PiA - Physics in Advent" we developed a special kind of Christmas calendar. We present 24 simple experiments for young scientist and everyone who likes it. The goal is to stimulate the fun of doing experiments yourself and to enjoy watching the phenomena.

From 1. to 24. December, we present a youtube movie with the experiment of the day in order for you to repeat it and to observe what happens. On our webpage, you can then answer the corresponding question via multiple-choice. We show our solution again via a youtube movie the next day. We mainly aim at high school students from age 11 to 18 years, classes and whole schools in Germany, Austria, Switzerland or any other country. Younger and older students as well as parents and teachers and everyone else who enjoys little experiments is also welcome. Enjoy! In this movie, PiA participants explain what PiA is and how it works.

title: Verantwortung von Wissenschaft

An der Universit√§t G√∂ttingen fand vom 27. Februar bis zum 2. M√§rz 2012 die Fr√ºhjahrstagung der Deutschen Physikalischen Gesellschaft (DPG) statt. Bohr, Enkel des d√§nischen Nobelpreistr√§gers Niels Bohr. Das zuk√ºnftige Museum der Universit√§t G√∂ttingen l√§dt dazu ein, Wissenschaft als einen Prozess zu verstehen, der von Menschen betrieben und bestimmt wird, die Entscheidungen f√ºr den einen oder anderen Weg treffen. Partner‚Äú leitet in enger Zusammenarbeit mit dem Geb√§udemanagement der Universit√§t G√∂ttingen den Bau des Forum Wissen, das sich durch eine umweltfreundliche und barrierefreie Architektur sowie eine innovative digitale Infrastruktur auszeichnen wird. title: Dangurangu: Klaus-Peter Brenner plays mbira
description:

Brenner‚Äôs rendition of the piece is based on a version he learnt from a 1993 field recording of his teacher and research partner, the late mbira genius Ephat Mujuru (1950‚Äì2001). 

Brenner is a researcher at the University of G√∂ttingen, Germany, Department of Musicology, and responsible for the Collection of Musical Instruments. Several of his academic publications deal with the structure and evolution of Shona mbira music. For an in-depth analysis of this piece, see his article ‚ÄúThe Mbira/Chimurenga Transformation of ‚ÄòDangurangu‚Äô ‚Ä¶‚Äú (2013).

title: HASCO Summer School 2018
description: The main objectives of the hadron collider physics summer school (HASCO) are introductory topics in elementary particle physics, in particular in hadron collider physics as relevant for research at the Large Hadron Collider (LHC). This includes lectures and tutorials on theoretical foundations of the Standard Model of elementary particle physics as well as experimental techniques to test it. Approximately 40 students and 10 lecturers from 15 institutes in Europe, Canada, China, Egypt, India, and South Africa attended the school from 22.7.-27.7.2018 with lectures and tutorials. More information at http://hasco.uni-goettingen.de

title: Voices of Struggle: LGBTQ and Feminist Activism in China and Beyond
description:
Our video series ‚ÄúVoices of Struggle: LGBTQ and Feminist Activism in China and Beyond‚Äù was filmed on the sidelines of a symposium of the same name held at the University of G√∂ttingen on 17 April 2018. In our conversations with four of the participants (Hongwei Bao, Maizi Li, Popo Fan, Harriet Evans) we explore the complex entanglements between activism and academia in transnational perspective. What does it mean to be an engaged or activist scholar today? How should we think about the connections/separations between the two spheres of activism and academia? And how can activists and academics best combine their strengths to effect change? In what ways are deepening transnational connections re-shaping the practice of activism around the globe? Our two day event brought together leading scholars and activists to discuss these questions in relation to the development of feminism and LGBTQ activism in China and beyond.



Li TingtingÊùéÂ©∑Â©∑ (also known by her nickname Li ‚ÄúMaizi‚Äù ÊùéÈ∫¶Â≠ê) is an activist for women‚Äôs and LGBTQ right in the PRC. Since 2012, she has become internationally known for organizing public performance art-style protests calling attention to gender equality issues. In 2012, she and two other activists walked down a shopping street in Beijing wearing a blood spattered gown to draw attention to domestic violence in China. Another action, the ‚ÄúOccupy Men‚Äôs Room‚Äù demonstration drew attention to the shortage of public women‚Äôs toilets by encouraging women to use men‚Äôs facilities.

 On 6 March 2015 she, along with four other feminist activists, were arrested in Beijing for planning to hand out stickers on the Beijing subway raising awareness about sexual harassment on International Women‚Äôs Day. Thanks to the efforts of other Chinese feminists, ‚ÄúFree the Five‚Äù became an international campaign that made headlines around the world. She, along with the other members of the Feminist Five, were detained by the Public Security Bureau for 37 days. 

Li previously studied public administration at Chang‚ÄôAn University (Xi‚ÄôAn) and is now studying human rights at the University of Essex in England where she continues her activist work.

title: Voices of Struggle: LGBTQ and Feminist Activism in China and Beyond
description:
Harriet Evans is Professor Emerita at the University of Westminster in London, where she headed the China section for many years. She is known for her highly influential work on women, gender and human rights in China, topics she also advises NGOs on.
Her main publications include Women and Sexuality in China: Discourses of Female Sexuality and Gender since 1949 (Polity Press, 1997), and Picturing Power in the People's Republic of China: Posters of the Cultural Revolution (co-edited with Stephanie Donald, Rowman and Littlefield, 1999) and The Subject of Gender: Daughters and Mothers in Urban China (Rowman and Littlefield, 2007).
She was President of the British Association for Chinese Studies (2002-5), has served on the Executive Committee of the Universities' China Committee in London, and is member of the Executive Committee of The China Quarterly. She was appointed Professor Emerita in March 2017;  is Chair of Trustees to the London-based NGO, The Rights Practice, and is Visiting Professor in Anthropology at the LSE.

Our video series ‚ÄúVoices of Struggle: LGBTQ and Feminist Activism in China and Beyond‚Äù was filmed on the sidelines of a symposium of the same name held at the University of G√∂ttingen on 17 April 2018. In our conversations with four of the participants (Hongwei Bao, Maizi Li, Popo Fan, Harriet Evans) we explore the complex entanglements between activism and academia in transnational perspective. What does it mean to be an engaged or activist scholar today? How should we think about the connections/separations between the two spheres of activism and academia? And how can activists and academics best combine their strengths to effect change? In what ways are deepening transnational connections re-shaping the practice of activism around the globe? Our two day event brought together leading scholars and activists to discuss these questions in relation to the development of feminism and LGBTQ activism in China and beyond.

title: What Makes a Superpower: New Perspectives on China‚Äôs Rise  Todd Hall (Oxford University)
description:
Prof Hall earned his PhD from the University of Chicago in 2008 and has held postdoctoral fellowships at Princeton and Harvard, as well as visiting scholar appointments at the Free University of Berlin, Tsinghua University in Beijing, and the University of Tokyo. Prior to joining the University of Oxford, Prof Hall held the position of Assistant Professor in Political Science at the University of Toronto (2010-2013). Research interests extend to the areas of international relations theory; the intersection of emotion, affect, and foreign policy; and Chinese foreign policy. Recent publications include articles in Asian Security, International Organization, International Security, International Studies Quarterly, International Studies Review, Political Science Quarterly, and Security Studies. Prof Hall has also published a book with Cornell University Press, titled Emotional Diplomacy: Official Emotion on the International Stage, which was recently named co-recipient of the International Studies Association‚Äôs 2016 Diplomatic Studies Section Book Award.
Prof Hall‚Äôs research fields include:
Theorizing the role of emotions and affect in international politics.
The international relations of East Asia, with a specific focus on the foreign policy of China.

Our video series ‚ÄúWhat Makes a Superpower: New Perspectives on China‚Äôs Rise‚Äù was filmed on the sidelines of our 2018 lecture series held at the University of G√∂ttingen from April to June. In our conversations with Liu Kang, Todd Hall and Saori Katade we discuss China‚Äôs rise from the angle of political thought and Chinese exceptionalism, debate emotions in international relations and examine China‚Äôs diplomacy as well as its role within the BRICS countries.

In this video Tod Hall discusses three questions:

1. Many scholars have compared Anglo-German rivalry before 1914 to the PRC-US relationship today. Why are such analogies problematic?

2. Which lessons of 1914 can we learn for East Asia today? 

3. How do affect and emotion shape international relations? Could you provide one or two examples from East Asia?

title: Where does vanilla come from?
description:
Around 80 percent of the world supply of natural vanilla originates from Madagascar, one of the world's poorest countries but one of the richest in terms of biodiversity.

One of the research projects of the University of G√∂ttingen, ‚ÄúDiversity Turn in Land Use Science‚Äù investigates the effects of vertical integration in the vanilla value chain. Scientists and scholars from five academic disciplines aim at developing more sustainable courses of action with respect to the land use system in which vanilla cropping takes place. For more information about the research project, please refer to https://youtu.be/4-OQx7fCnBM.

Video produced by Dennis M. Dellschow and Daria Kulemetieva
